Projects

My first job was in high school. I was RA'ing for Frankland's lab, the biggest hippocampal regeneration lab in the world. And it was truly big â€” thirty, forty students people? I helped slice mouse brains, make the mounts for optical fibres, count cells under the confocal microscope...

I got to play around in a chemistry lab after that. Making nanoparticles all day, drying them, sonicating them, suspending them in solutions.

I did my undergraduate in computer science.

Google X was a ML, signal processing role. We were trying to find a biomarker for depression

Interests

Meta stuff Whole brain emulation - with learning, can you characterize how/when learning happens? - there was this paper which used SVDs to show when categories would be discovered (temporally) - RDM (representational dissimilarity matrix) - Michael mentioned the advantage to C Elegans is being able to see the whole system Can you grow a circuit and ask it to learn?
